Please don't do the "Summary:" type tags in a commit message. Just explain why you are doing this commit. This doesn't seem to functionally change anything, will you be building on this in the future?

Removed, thank you for your reviewing.
We are not going to build new design on this,
just fix existed problem that using number of host instance to generate chassis targets since host 0 is invalid bus chassis 0 is necessary.
Need to keep your commit message lines under 80 chars
Revised, thank you for your reviewing.
tab here (and should be indented more)
Revised, thank you for your reviewing.
why not leave this one above in host block?
Revised, I think that there's no impact about the dependency to obmc-chassis-poweroff in file obmc-host-quiesce@.target. Thank you for your correction.
We still have issues here where we're tying chassis and host to each other. But we've always had that problem, this patch gets us closer at least to differentiating between host and chassis.

This separation is just used to easier avoid invalid host/chassis units.
It seems that there are still some former design mapping host to chassis or misuse between them in phosphor-state-manager.

A question, does this service should belong to HOST_DEFAULT_TARGETS or CHASSIS_DEFAULT_TARGETS?

In multi-host system, I saw phosphor-discover-system-state@0.service is waiting `xyz.openbmc_project.state.host0`, but host0 is not available for multi-host.
I'm going to merge this as is for now.  Let's get up a fix if there is a problem.

From document of systemd's description, if the listed units fail to start or cannot be added to the transaction, there's no impact on the validity of the transaction.
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.unit.html

So I think that the service's behavior won't be changed even host 0 is invalid, please help to tell us if there was an unexpected result.

Hi Delphine,

In Bletchley, I saw `mapper-wait@-xyz-openbmc_project-state-host0.service` are keep running, and it cause phosphor-discover-system-state@0.service & `multi-user.target` are always in waiting.

BMC state is depens on multi-user.target done, which BMC will keep in NotReady state in this case.

```
root@bletchley:~# systemctl list-jobs
JOB UNIT                                                                        TYPE  STATE  
228 phosphor-discover-system-state@0.service                                    start waiting
217 obmc-led-group-start@bmc_booted.service                                     start waiting
230 mapper-wait@-xyz-openbmc_project-control-host0-power_restore_policy.service start running
1   multi-user.target                                                           start waiting
229 mapper-wait@-xyz-openbmc_project-state-host0.service                        start running

5 jobs listed.
```

```
root@bletchley:~# systemctl status multi-user.target
* multi-user.target - Multi-User System
     Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/multi-user.target; indirect; preset: disabled)
     Active: inactive (dead)
       Docs: man:systemd.special(7)
root@bletchley:~# obmcutil bmcstate
CurrentBMCState     : xyz.openbmc_project.State.BMC.BMCState.NotReady
```
Is that Phenomenon can be recovered if you change the setting to HOST_DEFAULT_TARGETS?

Yes, it does not create phosphor-discover-system-state@0.service link in multi-user.target.wants after moving line to HOST_DEFAULT_TARGETS, so BMC won't wait for `mapper-wait@-xyz-openbmc_project-state-host0.service`

Bletchley's current obmc instances setting as below
- OBMC_HIST_INSTANCES = "1 2 3 4 5 6"
- OBMC_CHASSIS_INSTANCES = "0 1 2 3 4 5 6"

Update the commit to fix this phenomenon as below, if there no other concerned, I'll change the status to active for following code-review.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/60344
